Unnamed: 3: ratio of rated power in W / kerb mass in kg  <= 22
The table with the speed trace is named "WLTC_class_1" and contains a low and a medium speed part.
If v_max >= 70 km/h, phase low is repeated after phase medium.
If v_max < 70 km/h, phase medium is replaced by a repetition of phase low.
If a vehicle has a ratio of rated power in W divide by kerb mass in kg close to the borderline, any additional tests with the WLTC, class 2, version 1.4 cycle are highly welcomed.
ratio of rated power in W / kerb mass in kg  > 22 but <= 34
The table with the speed trace is named "WLTC_class_2" and contains a low, a medium and a high speed part.
If v_max < 90 km/h, phase high is replaced by a repetition of phase low.
If a vehicle with a ratio of rated power in W divided by kerb mass in kg between 22 and 34, but close to the lower borderline cannot follow the WLTC class 2, version 1.4 speed trac
it shall proceed at full throttle until the reference speed profile is reached again. This test shall be repeated at least 3 times. Additionally, the same vehicle can be tested
with the WLTC, class 1 , version 1.4 driving cycle (3 tests), provided that all the other provisions of the WLTP are the same as before.

If a vehicle has a ratio of rated power in W divided by kerb mass in kg between 22 and 34, but close to the upper borderline, any additional tests with the WLTC, class 3, version 5 cycle are highly welcomed.
ratio of rated power in W / kerb mass in kg  >  34
The table with the speed trace is named "WLTC_class_3" and contains a low, a medium, a high and an extra high speed part.
If v_max < 135 km/h, phase high is replaced by a repetition of phase low.
If a vehicle with a ratio of rated power in W divided by kerb masin kg  > 34, but close to this borderline cannot follow the WLTC class 3, version 5 speed trace
it shall proceed at full throttle until the reference speed profile is reached again. This test shall be repeated at least 3 times. Additionally, the same vehicle can be tested
with the WLTC, class 2 , version 1.4 driving cycle (3 tests), provided that all the other provisions of the WLTP are the same as before.
kerb mass means the "unladen mass" as defined in ECE R83.
v_max is the maximum speed of the vehicle as declared by the manufacturer (ECE R 68) and not any use restriction or safety based limitation.
